content: The Family of Issachar(A)
The sons of Issachar  Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron—four

The sons of Tola  Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father’s house.  of Tola  mighty men of valor in their generations; their number in the days of David  twenty-two thousand six hundred.
The son of Uzzi  Izrahiah, and the sons of Izrahiah  Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah. All five of them  chief men.
And with them, by their generations, according to their fathers’ houses,  thirty-six thousand troops ready for war; for they had many wives and sons.
Now their brethren among all the families of Issachar  mighty men of valor, listed by their genealogies, eighty-seven thousand in all.
The Family of Benjamin(D)
of Benjamin  Bela, Becher, and Jediael—three
The sons of Bela were Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri—five  They  heads of  fathers’ houses, and they were listed by their genealogies, twenty-two thousand and thirty-four mighty men of valor.
The sons of Becher  Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jerimoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these  the sons of Becher.
And they were recorded by genealogy according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, twenty thousand two hundred mighty men of valor.
The son of Jediael  Bilhan, and the sons of Bilhan  Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
All these sons of Jediael  heads of their fathers’ houses;  seventeen thousand two hundred mighty men of valor fit to go out for war  battle.
Shuppim and Huppim  the sons of Ir,  Hushim  the son of Aher.
The Family of Naphtali(F)
The sons of Naphtali  Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.
The Family of Manasseh (West)
The descendants of Manasseh: his Syrian concubine bore him Machir the father of Gilead, the father of Asriel.
Machir took as his wife  of Huppim and Shuppim, whose name  Maachah. The name of  grandson  Zelophehad, but Zelophehad begot only daughters.
(Maachah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh. The name of his brother  Sheresh, and his sons  Ulam and Rakem.
The son of Ulam  Bedan.) These  the descendants of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.
His sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
And the sons of Shemida were Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
The Family of Ephraim
The sons of Ephraim  Shuthelah, Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eladah his son, Tahath his son,
Zabad his son, Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead. The men of Gath who were born in  land killed  because they came down to take away their cattle.
Then Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.
And when he went in to his wife, she conceived and bore a son; and he called his name Beriah, because tragedy had come upon his house.
Now his daughter  Sheerah, who built Lower and Upper Beth Horon and Uzzen Sheerah;
and Rephah  his son,  as Resheph, and Telah his son, Tahan his son,
Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,
Nun his son, and Joshua his son.
Now their possessions and dwelling places  Bethel and its towns: to the east Naaran, to the west Gezer and its towns, and Shechem and its towns, as far as Ayyah and its towns;
and by the borders of the children of Manasseh  Beth Shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, Dor and its towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph, the son of Israel.
The Family of Asher(S)
The sons of Asher  Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
The sons of Beriah  Heber and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
And Heber begot Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
The sons of Japhlet  Pasach, Bimhal, and Ashvath. These  the children of Japhlet.
The sons of Shemer  Ahi, Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.
And the sons of his brother Helem  Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
The sons of Zophah  Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Jithran, and Beera.
The sons of Jether  Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
The sons of Ulla  Arah, Haniel, and Rizia.

All these  the children of Asher, heads of  fathers’ houses, choice men, mighty men of valor, chief leaders. And they were recorded by genealogies among the army fit for battle; their number  twenty-six thousand.
